page.title: 04MEDIA
page.content: From the survey we conducted in Collingham and a surronding area we came to these conclusions. (1) The Herald and the Wetherby Advertiser were the main papers delivered. (2) The main items of local news in June 1985 were a bad road crash between a car and a tanker at the Collingham road junction.This is a frequent place for road crashes. there had been some vandalism in the churchyard,a burglary where several jewels were stolen,and a dog fight. Apart from all this no one could recall any thing else,most people said it was a quiet ,even boring village. (3) In most familys only two people read the papers and they were the adults.When interviwed the newsagent said on average he sold 17948 papers a week.
